posts.body:
>>87a00499-57e0-4fe8-b678-24291dafd551
Good filters is exactly what this site needs or the next spamwave will fuck it up even more.
Would be nice if it would be implemented in the site tho.

>>f670ab3d-d9ae-4221-b076-9f5fcc9353c2
>I'm creating a Gitlab (is there a ZN alternative)?
Git Center
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/
You are just going to need the html for 08chan.net? I can check it out later today what i can help with.
doing gods work

This whole zeronet thing could have been so nice if it wouldn't be so buggy and have so many issues.
Why can't we have nice things?

>>35b96368-95a4-4f2c-a435-9f354eb70a32
that didn't last long

Hotwheels is obsessed with reporting 8kun to everywhere possible, even though that it's not even online.

wtf. is wrong with that traitor?

Link to that faggots twitter, in case that i am not online long enough to seed the screencap 
https://twitter.com/HW_BEAT_THAT

>>1b39bd04-c8da-4930-b343-c90d48540db8
my main issue is that the problem of it easily getting flooded with spam is still not resolved.

Creating a ZeroID is centralized and runs over one server and it can be shut down. So if you force the users to create an ID, you have the same problems as if you host the website on the normienet. But you need something like that in order to control who is posting on the site, just like a captcha would always be centralised (if it wouldn't, a bot could just verify his own captchas).

The next problem is that i don't have as much control over the content that i seed than i would like to.
We need as many possibilities to filter content as possible, to deal with spam and to deal with the infinite growing diskspace that ZeroNet uses. Filter by keyword, filter by RegExp, bayesian filter (whats used by mail spam-filters), fiter by user, filter by date, filter by age of user, all  for new content and for deleting already saved content. And then shared filter lists, just like uBlock has ad-filterlists.

And it needs a good easily accessable interface for browsing through whats saved. People were surprised here that everybody can see their posting history if they just wade through the folders and check out the users content.json. Users should know this since the very beginning, providing a nice interface to whats saved from what user and whats seeded should be the most important part of the whole platform.

Most of those things need to be solved in ZeroNet itself. It just feels like nobody ever asked the question:
>hmm, what happens if someone just floods some zite with 10000 messages?

Knowing that every autist with enough dedication could flood this board (and every single other ZeroNet site) with 1000 messages from permanently new created IDs is very demotivating.

>>77287c0b-7bb3-4cff-89ec-e7a2b27d1199
Nice to see that people are trying to tackle this. But seeing how limited the current CAs are, it most likely means huge changes that aren't backwards compatible.
And that means lots of time till anything comes out of it... but it really has to be done, i do not see the point in ZeroNet without it.

Maybe i will join you. Was looking a bit through ZeroNet code and that linked ZeroID code and i think i am able to deal with that.

>>b361cf53-47b8-49da-9cae-c4af697c1978
As those changes aren't possible without making core changes about how ZeroNet handles certificates, i guess that you are running  an ZeroNet-incompatible dezentralised network with you as the only peer?

Sounds very promising, bro.
Fuck that cripple
That's why you kill traitors before your enemies.

>>200e4375-bec5-471d-a73a-5a3163eae093
>Regarding traffic, maybe some sort of standalone "pocket" version of everything to distribute would help attract and hold more users. Something like a zip file that has zeronet, the required version of python that is portable, a portable browser, and a shortcut to 08chan in it. Something kind of all-in-one like the tor browser that removes the extra legwork of getting everything set up? I'll try putting something like that together.

It would have to be the tor browser bundle itself + zeronet.

>>ca8eb594-af8a-4243-a7fa-6e81e109122e
All clearnet chans have more child porn than there is here, but somehow whenever someone mentions something on an onion service or dezentraized, you get a flood of concerned postings about muh child porn.
I wonder if those people are afraid of bittorrent too, it's the same thing.
It's ridiculous.

>>c13a92f0-34e5-4a30-83c9-b9d89b593ee6
> vch.moe 
am i seeing that right, that there isn't even a /pol/ in their webring and they do none of those sites allow every sinlge board request, because it would shit up their board index that they can't filter?
ok

>>ed4b5534-f231-4e62-b917-b63032d0cd1e
kek, i just had the same issue and found the same solution and posted it in ZeroTalk.
Looks like i was late to the party and should have checked it out earlier.

Jim recently posted a pic of server racks in a car, they are still trying to get it up.
I hope they succeed. Even if the clearnet seems gone, zeronet (or other solutions) really aren't ready yet.

Still here and lurking. 
And i prefer 08chan over those little webring boards. Those just seem like honeypots and the users there smell like cuckchan.

>>056d4cce-a364-4bc1-85a4-132e2edccdf7
>got hit with a colossal DDoS attack today. Julay.world and vch.moe were both taken completely offline despite the latter using Cuckflare, and the rest of the ring was hit to one degree or another. Most of it was down for several hours.
And as it turned out, julay.world didn't even have a monitoring service to restart automatically after error, and vch.moe is running old vichan and cuckflare doesn't help them at all, because its set to allow you to bypass cache with a cache breaker (random query string).

The webring chan admins didn't really think into possible attacks that much. I bet it wasn't even a DDoS, but just some guy running a script to spam requests.
I don't trust those the current webring at all.

When participating in reddit, i would just peretend to be one crazy lefty group and talk bad about another.
That's the only thing reddit is good for.
Especially the trannies vs. TERFs fights are glorious.
Disclaimer: this post and the subject matter and contents thereof - text, media, or otherwise - do not necessarily reflect the views of the 8kun administration.

>>fff7e1a8-fa92-4ab1-8b20-afe6741d884e
tbh. it's not the admins fault
You can't expect him to fix problems that can just be fixed by making changes to zeronet itself that are so huge that you might just rewrite the whole thing from scratch.

As long as there is no obvious convenient way to browse and check out all the files and messages that you are seeding + the only way to stop some bot from posting 100 messages per second or implementing captchas is a centralized server handing out certificates like zeroid, it's dead in the water.

As soon as you rely on one centralized server, you aren't decentralized anymore and the whole purpose is gone. You can just as well post on a clearnet site instead. You don't have more privacy here.

If i would be the developer, i wouldn't bother too much either, i would just keep an eye on general zeronet development and maybe give some input there when i can, but i wouldn't waste my time developing this board, wasting my time as long as general issues with the platform itself persist.
